page.title: 18Acton Church Brass.
page.content: In Acton Church is the third earliest full length brass effigy in England.It is of Sir Robert de Bures, (1302)and shows a figure dressed in chain mail, partly covered by a sur coat.He is wearing a sword and spurs and carrying a shield bearing his coat of arms.At his feet is a lion, which is the symbol of courage. Sir Robert held land in 15 Suffolk villages.It was acquired through marriage as well as being land which is held by defeated rebel nobelmen and given to him by King Edward 2nd. The brass has become so popular for brass rubbing that a copy has been made.
